description.narrative: The Philippines is a country where 17 million people live below the poverty line. It has persistent high levels of inequality and vulnerability. Further, it is one of the most highly at-risk countries from disasters, with pockets of fragility that threaten its stability and development. However, the Philippines is also classified as a lower middle-income country. The country#s recent macro-economic performance has been strong, and the government has made clear commitments with respect to poverty reduction. While these developments are positive, inequality is growing and poverty remains persistent. Oxfam has been working in the country for over 25 years. In the Philippines, our goal is to contribute to the eradication of poverty by supporting women and other vulnerable groups in saving lives and building livelihoods, enhancing their resilience to crises, shocks and stresses, and making their voices heard to hold duty-bearers accountable. This project involves a research assignment to provide two case studies describing climate change impacts, local adaptation planning processes and the availability of funding to implement these plans for two different locations in the Philippines. These case studies will feed into an Oxfam Philippines briefing paper thatdescribes the extent to which local planning processes and international climate finance open up or limit climate change adaptation options for people in the Philippines. This in turn, is part of a larger programme implemented in different countries across the world and feeds into Oxfam#s local, national andinternational climate change advocacy.

participating-org.narrative: Oxfam Great Britain#s Philippine office has been in existence since 1987. It has maintained a developmental program in the country that has gradually shifted from relief and basic services provision to a more rights-based developmental approach. Oxfam Great Britain has supported community-based coastal resources management since the early 1990s, as an approach towards an integration of coastal ecosystem rehabilitation, poverty alleviation, and political equity concerns for small-scale sectors. Oxfam inthe Philippines works towards a future where Filipinos, especially women and other vulnerable sectors, are free from the injustices of poverty. During emergencies, we respond with life-saving aid while supporting people recover their livelihoods. Everyday, we drive change by working hand-in-hand with our partners in finding practical yet innovative ways to help families lift themselves out of poverty by influencing decisions that affect them.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to a sustainable livelihood

description.narrative: Improved policies: # of cases where Oxfam/partners influenced governments or global actors in adopting/implementating policies on (i) Sustainable Food production and consumption, (ii) Land Rights and (iii) Climate Change with a gender senstive lens.
